title: Start
body:
<<set $medic_loyalty to 4>>

<<Textbox>>
<<name|Captain>>
<<portrait|captain_neutral>>
Attention!
<</Textbox>>

<<Textbox>>
<<name|Medic>>
<<portrait|medic_neutral>>
Sir! (Salutes)
<</Textbox>>

[[What can you tell me about this residue?|ResidueClueBegin]]
[[We'll talk more later.|ExitConversation]]

title: ResidueClueBegin
body:
<<Textbox>>
<<name|Medic>>
<<portrait|medic_neutral>>
Apologies, Captain! Unfortunately, due to the anatomy of my species, we sometimes...
<</Textbox>>

<<Textbox>>
<<name|Medic>>
<<portrait|medic_talking>>
Wait a second...
<</Textbox>>

<<Textbox>>
<<name|Medic>>
<<portrait|medic_talking>>
This is definitely not from me. The color, the texture...
and look how it cured!
<</Textbox>>

[[So what's it from?|MedicAnalysis]]
[[You sure about that?|MedicSuspicious]]

title: MedicAnalysis
body:
<<Textbox>>
<<name|Medic>>
<<portrait|medic_neutral>>
Well, it's definitely biological. And I'm pretty sure humans don't produce something like this.
<</Textbox>>

<<Textbox>>
<<name|Medic>>
<<portrait|medic_talking>>
That leaves the First Mate. It's rare, but his species does produce something like this in moments of great stress.
<</Textbox>>

[[Sounds pretty concrete to me.|ConfirmFirstMate]]
[[That sounds ridiculous.|MedicSuspicious]]

title: ConfirmFirstMate
body:
<<Textbox>>
<<name|Medic>>
<<portrait|medic_talking>>
It does, but let me do a few tests before we go pointing fingers.
<</Textbox>>

<<Textbox>>
("Residue" Key Dialogue Unlocked)
<</Textbox>>

[[We'll talk more later.|ExitConversation]]

title: MedicSuspicious
body:
<<Textbox>>
<<name|Medic>>
<<portrait|medic_upset>>
Excuse me, Captain, but if you don't have faith in me, then I'd appreciate being left to my duties.
<</Textbox>>

<<Textbox>>
<<set $medic_loyalty to $medic_loyalty - 1>>
(Medic Loyalty -1)
<</Textbox>>
